sentences.sentence: More Wagner mercenaries are reported to have moved to Belarus as part of the deal brokered by President Alexander Lukashenko to end their mutiny.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: As the world experiences a wave of extreme weather, US Special Climate Envoy John Kerry is in China for talks aimed at reviving climate cooperation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: More mercenaries from Russia's Wagner military group are set to have rolled into Belarus as part of the deal that ended their mutiny.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Film of some Wagner members instructing Belarusian territorial defence forces was released last week, although the video hasn't been independently verified.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There are reports of over 100 vehicles carrying Russian flags and Wagner insignia heading towards a field camp that Belarusian authorities have offered the company.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: President Alexander Lukashenko, who brokered a deal that ended last month's rebellion launched by Wagner chief Evgeny Prigozhin, has said that his country's military could benefit from the mercenaries' combat experience.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In Russia, Wagner's main base is closing down, according to a report on a Telegram channel linked to the paramilitary group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A post showed a video of flags being lowered at the base, which is located in Russia's Krasnodar region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The base in Molkino is ceasing to exist, was the message, and the group is leaving for new deployment sites, it went on to say.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Prigozhin ordered his mercenaries back to their camps after striking a deal to end the rebellion in exchange for an amnesty for him and his men and permission to move to Belarus. Ukraine's armed forces say there were several overnight attacks by drones.

sentences.sentence: Explosions were heard in Mykolaiv and the Black Sea port of Odessa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: They said dozens of attack drones of Iranian origin were used in the raids, adding that Odessa was also targeted with Kalibr cruise missiles, but that all the rockets were shot down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Russia said its armed forces also shot down 28 Ukrainian drones over Crimea on Monday night.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Writing on Telegram, the Defense Ministry said 17 were destroyed by air defenses, while a further 11 were what it called neutralized and crashed after failing to reach their targets.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin meanwhile has promised a response to Ukraine's second attack on a key bridge in Crimea which took place early on Monday morning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The Kremlin said traffic is now flowing again on the crossing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Putin said he expected concrete proposals to improve security on the bridge, which is important for supplying Russian troops in Ukraine.

sentences.sentence: Life in Ukraine remains a living hell.

sentences.sentence: This statement was made during a briefing at the UN Security Council on the ongoing humanitarian crisis in Ukraine 500 days after Russia first invaded.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: that have hit several countries in the Mediterranean basin. In Greece strong winds are hampering the work of firefighters who have had to attend to multiple fronts southeast and west of Athens. Three towns and a summer camp with more than 900 children have been evacuated. Police have arrested a man suspected of arson. In Spain the fire that broke out on Saturday on the island of La Palma is Gradually weakening although it has still several active fronts Authorities estimate that some three and a half thousand hectares and 20 buildings have been burnt Most of the 4,000 people who were evacuated on Saturday have already returned to their homes were evacuated on Saturday have already returned to their homes. The heatwave and the risk of fires has also reached Italy, where thermometers could comfortably exceed 40 degrees these days.

sentences.sentence: Police are investigating the origin of the fire that broke out Saturday night at Catania airport.

sentences.sentence: Authorities have suspended all flights until Wednesday. Five people died and eight more were injured when a small plane crashed into a hangar at

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Marine biologists are conducting a massive post-mortem investigation following the mass stranding of some 55 pilot whales on a beach in Scotland's Western Isles on Sunday. It's believed that only one of them made it back into the sea, with the rest dying naturally or being euthanized on welfare grounds. It's the highest number of deaths following a mass stranding of animals in the UK in the last 70 years. It's not immediately clear why they became stranded, but one theory is that the pod may have followed a female whale onto the beach when she experienced problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Princess Diana's iconic black sheep jumper is going up for auction next month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: When she wore it, it sparked speculation that the black sheep depicted might symbolize how the young royal felt about herself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A newly engaged Diana Spencer wore it to watch her future husband Prince Charles play polo back in 1981. The black sheep motif was a little hint of the nineteen-year-old humor and sense of style.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Sotheby's has put an estimate of around 71,000 euros on the item but it could go for a lot more.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A Diana dress recently went for 533,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It has been described as an epidemic more. A Diana dress recently went for 533,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It has been described as an epidemic linked to the gradual aging of humanity. Alzheimer's a disease that steals the very identity of those afflicted by it and irreparably erodes their mental faculties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Until recently there's been no effective treatment. Now American pharmaceutical company Eli Lilly says it's developed a new drug, the Nanomab, that slows cognitive decline in Alzheimer's patients by up to 35%, a potential game-changer if taken early. We're actually about to start a called primary prevention in people with genetic Alzheimer's disease.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They know they have a mutation but they are 25 years or so before they're due to get symptoms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The aim is if you can give them an anti-amyloid therapy, can you prevent the disease ever starting?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And we're going to start that in the next few months which I think is really exciting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Eli Lilly is now calling on health authorities to approve the nanomab, which works in the same way as the canemab approved for use in the U.S. earlier this month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Somewhere in the Black Mountains of Wales, an unlikely crop is being cultivated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Daffodils which are grown at higher altitudes hold a special power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: They produce a crucial medical compound, a key component in pills to combat Alzheimer's.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Recent studies reveal another potentially astonishing benefit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Early evidence shows high altitude daffodils produce extract which when fed to cows has the unique ability to reduce methane emissions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The challenge to get flower crops to grow consistently on mountaintops. We found when we tried to grow daffodils here that all the traditional practices from the daffodil industry from decades didn't work and didn't apply. In the end, we had to throw out the rule book and completely reinvent the whole process from start to finish.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The daffodil is synonymous with Wales.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's the national flower of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: But the last place you'd expect it to be grown here is the Black Mountains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The reason it is, although it's challenging, is because these conditions are the perfect conditions to produce the crucial compound when it comes to reducing methane. It became apparent very quickly that daffodils are packed full of very powerful bioactive compounds.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Cows and other farm animals contribute approximately 14% of human-induced climate emissions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Scientists are hopeful that as well as reducing emissions, daffodil extract can make animal digestive systems more efficient.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: What we also are expecting to see is an improvement in protein utilisation, which means that we can start looking at animal diets and perhaps reducing some of the protein they're getting in because they're going to get more out of what they're what's being fed so that's a really also really promising benefit from this additive. The UK government is now backing a four-year trial which if successful could have profound implications. It's quite an unreal situation in front of us now the potential it could make to change the world on a number of levels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: It's incredibly exciting and very scary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: While not the only solution to climate change, this trial has the potential to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and help slow down the increasing global temperatures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Luke Hanrahan, Euronews, Wales.
